-Check.  Good bartenders, friendly, helpful and not afraid to bust my balls when I was getting a little too mushy with my girlfriend.  Fair enough and it's pretty hilarious.  

If I lived about three blocks closer, I'd be here about twice a week.
author: Steven R.

description: I love you Shotwells. You are a cozy snug pub with arcade games and a wide variety of beers. I love your wood paneling and I love that I can always have a handle for my beer when I order a Kostritzer. You are quick and always give me correct change. Thank you.
author: Megan G.

description: I liked this place a lot and it reminded me of my old Chicago neighborhood haunts. The bartender was knowledgable and served me the best Hefeweisen I've ever had, a darker one I can't remember the name of, but if you ask her I'm sure she will tell you. Great selection, clean and simple decor, and dark....interesting vibe and good people.
author: Lauren C.

description: I wish I could pick this bar up and move it to North Carolina. My husband and I came here twice while we were in SF, and both times we had bartenders who were really friendly, helpful, and funny. Beer selection is great. The bar was around the corner from the Inn San Francisco, where we were staying, and it was just really nice to be able to hang out in an unpretentious, laid back bar to unwind after running around and being touristy during the day.
author: Jenni C.

description: Very cool local pub with good beer selections - friendly spacious cozy and just good stuff. I loved my Abita pecan ale.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Extremely rude bartender  gave me attitude when I unknowingly handed him my credit card.  Since this place is cash only, he gave me a glare and said "You new around here?  We're cash only."  

Living in the 21st century, I rarely ever carry cash, let alone enough for a round of drinks for friends.  Total was $20 for 4 beers, and  I gave $20 (all I had at the moment) then began to ask my friends for some bills to leave him a tip.  The bartender, assuming that I did not plan to tip,  decides to yell out at me, "REALLY DUDE?   WOW.... just WOW"

Needless to say, I will never come back here.  This guy was a total buzz kill.
author: Ben M.

description:
I like pretty much everything about this bar, though I have a hard time calling it by any name other than the Inner Mission.  Why change the name if that's the only thing that changes?  Still the same solid selection of draft beers, the same pool tables, the same laid back crowd, the same Obama paraphernalia, and the same too-few tables.  I am also a fan of the jukebox and though I have not played pinball yet, I like that it's there.  

The bartenders are superbly friendly and (as I already mentioned) the beer selection is very good, covering an impressive range of beers.  No brown ales on tap, but I've come to accept that San Francisco is apparently not a brown ale kind of city.  Some friends of mine always order the sangria, which is also good and cheap.  The bartenders don't seem to mind when you bring in snacks of any kind, which is good of them.  On nights when you can find a seat, this is the place.
author: Josh C.

description:
"Hey, your pinball fell into my beer."  OK, maybe Reese's is safe with the world's best combination of good things, but Shotwell's isn't too far behind.  

Pinball + Great beer + Wonderful folks(employed and patrons) + ChexMix + Baseball on TVs + Location 

Dracula (5balls/$.75)
Medieval Madness (5balls/$.75)

Anderson Valley Brother David's Triple and Russian River's Damnation were the two *new* beers.  My 1st trip there so I don't know how often that changes.

Also available on tap were some SF classics:  Anchor Liberty Ale / Anchor Steam Beer / Speakeasy Big Daddy / Speakeasy Hunter's Point Porter 

Others I forgot and a limited selection of bottled beers too.  (Limited only because of my personal beer snobmanship and other bottleshops Mecca like selections, but lacking they are not)

The bartender was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the product.  Amazingly enough, these seemingly basic attributes are rarely all found in today's version of customer service.  All the Sunday customers were having a good time talking, watching the World Baseball Classic, playing pool, reading, and enjoying the SnackMix stuff that was offered in bowls.  One thing I always remember about a bar, is the salty goods that they offer while you're drinking.  Hmm, salty goods make me drink more $5-$7 beers, why would a bar owner OK giving me $1.43 in crackers?  A trick it is not, an added service with a high return is exactly what it is.

Yes, all those things together is what makes me happy and SHOTWELL'S is a clean, comfy place to enjoy them all.
author: Smiley D.

description:
I really like the vibe of this place.  it was crowded, but a good bar on a friday night should be!

i think the pool inside is free, so that's good.  nice crowd...cool lighting.  the hefenweisen is huge.
author: Lawrence C.

description:
Shotwell's is amazing. Incredible beer selection (they have Delirium Tremens and Wittekerke), cool bartenders, pool tables, a good jukebox, et cetera, et cetera.

Shotwell's (née Inner Mission Beer Parlor) was my favourite bar when I lived closer; now I'll take any opportunity to go there again.
author: Andrew W.

description:
My husband and I converted all our friends to being Shotwell-ites, too!
It's official! This is the best bar in the universe!

[Only downside: the husband now spends all our laundry quarters on pinball! But it's so fun to watch him play! Ack!]
author: Erin P.

description: Great selection, clean and well-tuned pinball. The staff is particularly cool.
author: Matt B.

description: Super fast, friendly service. Sat in a booth by the fire...very cozy. Guinness was really good and so was Bloody Mary.,
author: Sarah L.

description:
Great vibe to this place - I like the neighborhood feel of it.  The layout of the bar is well-done and the decor is a nice balance of kitch and class.  This is strictly a beer bar which is cool - but sometimes a guy wants a vodka soda.

The bartender was cool.  Only downside - no creditcards accepted (but I can live with that).  Half the fun is watching some bad pool and having some great conversation - I will definitely be back.
author: prior O.

description: Really great little pub located on a quiet corner in the Mission. We love going here for happy hour on Fridays before the crowds come in - usually between 5-7 is good. The bar staff are always happy to suggest a brew and they have good pretzel snacks distributed generously across the bar. Hubby loves this place because it's dog friendly - adds to the vibe and entertainment. Over the holidays they had a fantastic mulled wine. Would love to see more seasonal drink specials. Interested in dropping in here for St Paddy's day this weekend....
author: Nadia G.

description: Super nice guy owns the place and the bar is dog friendly! He had some great dog treats for my dog, so she's sold and I had a great little cocktail at a great price in my neighborhood. Good stuff. :)
author: Autumn B.

description: Shotwell's is just totally deserving of its 4.5 stars.  I freaking love it here, and while I'm biased for it being my neighborhood bar, I really couldn't ask for anything better (okay, it'd be great if they served food, but at least they're on the tamale lady's route).  Extra star for being the only bar in SF (afaik) with Palm beer.
author: Jillian Y.

description:
I will be the first to admit that Shotwell's isn't quite my scene, but I wanted to give it a chance anyway. 

Once I arrived (after reading rave reviews here), I realized that I have been to this bar before, circa 3 years ago. 

Anyway, it's probably my fault, but I ordered the board special "sangria," instead of one of the many beers on tap, and quite frankly I was disappointed. 

What kind of place serves "sangria," sans fruity chunks of delicious vitamin a, b, and c? How else am I going to avoid scurvy? The sangria was poured from a plastic pitcher...I could see the fruit chunks IN the pitcher, but just wine was poured into my glass of ice...so, it was more like a wine cooler?! 

Hmm....
author: Misha F.

description: Shotwell's is my favorite bar in the Mission. The beer selection here is hand-picked and has some of the best Belgian and specialty beers I've ever seen including some styles I'd never tried with totally reasonable prices for what they are serving. The staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is definitely neighborhood bar. Pub quiz on Monday is awesome too, competition is fierce! Awesome place to hang out with friends, drink some of the best beer around, shoot a game of pool, and stumble home with a smile on your face.
author: Chris H.

description: The owner made contact with me but not my friend that was totally offended by this establishment!  A for effort but IGNORE for not dealing with the person who experienced the RACISM!
author: Desiree M.

description: We stopped in here for a pre-dinner drink and I could have easily stayed the entire night! The bartender was super friendly and turned us all onto  my new favorite beer combo - the Shipyard Smashed Pumpkin topped with Young's Double Chocolate Stout.  It's the perfect place to grab a beer, or two, and catch up with friends. I can't wait until my next visit up North to go back!
author: Alma E.

description: Great beer selection, friendly staff, generous and engaging.  What more could you want.  Also, really cool vintage beer signs.
author: Ken H.

description:
Just moved into the neighborhood today (Sunday), had heard great things about Shotwell's.  Earlier in the day had noticed the sign on the door, happy hour until 7:30 Mon-Sat, and until 8 on Sundays.  Great.  

Just before 8, we walk in, and ask if happy hour is still on.  Bartender looks at clock, that's running fast  (8:10), and says happy hour is over.  I smile and say "clock's a bit fast"... bartender, with a nice dose of attitude: "It ends at 7:30, so it's well past."  

Wasn't going to make a fuss, ordered drinks, double-checked the sign on the door and the sign on the bar.  It's from 4-8 on Sundays.

Just before leaving, I show her one of the signs-- "Just so you know I'm not crazy, happy hour's until 8 on Sundays."  

Bartender, while looking at the sign that says 8:  "Oh! That's funny!  It's actually till 7 on Sundays!"  

???????? Are you kidding?
author: Jason M.

description: I love, love, love this bar!  As a liquor drinker, this is really saying something as they only have beer and wine.  The beer selection is damn near curated its so good, with an array of draft and bottled beers that go well beyond the usual suspects.  The bartenders are always nice, not too cheery or too gruff, and - here's the kicker - the *crowd* is great.  Maybe this place is just off the radar of all the people who crash the Mission on nights and weekends, but its always just so comfy and laid back in here, I can't get enough!
author: Daryl W.

description:
I would have given this place 4 stars, but one bartender ruined the end of the evening here...

I came here with 10 other friends after dinner to chat and hangout. We walked a few blocks to get there and had plenty to drink during dinner so first thing I asked for was a cup of ice water while everyone took a look at the big beer selection. Ironically everyone in my party was thinking the same thing (but others already had started to order beer as well). One bartender was really nice, the place is nicely decorated with good seating. Overall, it was a great place so we decided to stay there instead of hopping to another bar that was on the schedule.

1:20am was rolling around and many people from my group had to drive at least an hour to two hours to get home, so drivers were trying to sober up before heading home. 

My friend went to the bar to ask for 2 cups of ice water just a few minutes before we were planning on getting the group together to leave. The other bartender said, and I quote:

"NO! You guys have been ordering waters all night...it's NOT funny. No!"
he shakes his head and continues to chat with an annoyed face with his co-bartender and some customers at the bar.

I understand they're trying to make money, but it wasn't like my party of 10+ people didn't order good amounts of beer and give tips. It was a nice place...but "Last calls" were going to happen soon, people are being responsible by slowing alcohol consumption, hydrating, before going behind the wheel and we get rejected with rudeness!!!

If that didn't happen, I would've gave better. But that ruined the whole experience! Ruined the night so some left the party and headed home, others of us hopped over to a new bar, and had some more drinks that they could have made money on....
author: blanc m.

description:
This neighborhood bar was a pleasant surprise. Having passed it many times on my bicycle, I associated the television showing sports with the kind of place I'm usually not that into. But I finally gave it a shot and really liked it. Two things in particular make this a winner:

1. The owner, David, is awesome. Good company, good recommendations for drinks and for places to eat nearby, nice guy.

2. Great selection of tasty Belgian beers at reasonable prices.

I'll be back!
author: Jon A.

description: Great neighborhood vibe even if you're from out of town. Paul is about as wise and generous a bartender as you'll find anywhere - he has superb taste in beer and gives sage advice like you'd expect of an old timey barkeep, not to mention excellent music tastes. An excellent choice as a bar patron and beer drinker of any background
author: Alan C.

description:
Another good Mission bar.

They had Liberty Ale and Big Daddy on tap. My friends were also very happy about the Molson and some other good beers that I can't even remember their names. They don't have hard alcohol but they do have wine and sangria. They also only take cash.

There's a pool table in the back, tables along the sides and a decent sized bar. They have happy hour, even on Sunday until 7.
author: Jackie G.

description: There's just something about this place that I really really like. It's small, cozy/saloon-ish decor at the bar, good beer selection, mellow (at least the two times I've been there)...oh, that's right, it hits all my prerequisites for fun divey bars! Came here on a late Friday night and it was busy, but not too packed. Hung out at the bar, enjoyed my beer (I do love me some Dogfish Head), and was able to have a non-screaming conversation with friend. My second visit was on a Friday night during that weird in between happy hour and out out time...totally dead. I'm ok with that. I'll be back. I'll also remember cash. Third time's a charm.
author: Karena Q.

description: My girlfriend and I went to Shotwells the bartenders were funny, and the drinks were excellent . We had so much fun with some of the regulars that we didn't want to leave. It was a trivia night  the bartenders new how to pour a great drink and every one was happy.
author: rachelle t.

description: Tom was very generous with the pours, and the beer selection was outstanding. The stout was creamy and delicious, the IPA hoppy and crisp. I played some pinball with George, a game of pool with new friends whose names I was too drunk to remember, and played some air guitar with Willie and Brian when the jukebox played Zepplin. Then the tamale lady showed up. What a great place!
author: Robert M.

description: Awesome beer choices, and it's never too crowded. Also, free bar snacks... can't complain :)
author: Willa K.

description:
I walked in to see one guy at the end of the bar watching baseball with a beer and no one else to be seen.  Soon enough I found out that he was the bartender/owner, so I liked this place immediately.  David (the owner/bartender) is a nice guy who made me feel right at home at the closest bar to my new place and I'll be back again (probably today).

They have an excellent beer supply with good taps at reasonable prices.  I'm glad to have a cool bar so close to home.
author: Jim S.

description: Not sure what impresses me more, the 1891 establishment date,  the friendly service, the  pool tables, or THE KILLER BEER SELECTION!!!!!! I'm a sour beer fan and The Monk's Cafe is one of my faves and Shotwell's has it on tap! Great place to hang out in the evening or any time.
author: Scott L.

description: If you've lived in the mission for a while, you want a bar that's not totally slammed every friday@ 6, but isn't clooney's or the broken record.  This is the bar.  Don't let them go out of business.
author: Hawkeye P.

description:
Oh Shotwell's. Where to begin...

This is my kind of bar. I don't like mixed drinks or shots, and I get really tired of the generic beers at most bars. A fantastic beer selection and guys (and gals!) behind the bar who REALLY, I mean, REALLY know their beers. I'm terrible at making decisions (and you will be too, if you had to choose from their taps/bottles), so I often ask for recommendations with some ideas of what I'm looking for. And they've never let me down. 

Been here both on weekdays and weekends. Prefer the weekdays or weekend afternoons (to catch some obscure hockey game on their NHL Center Ice package) because it's less crowded, low-key. But it also never gets disgusting/sweaty-crowded like other bars, even during peak hours. 

Honestly, this place should get six (or seven or eight or nine...) stars.
author: Christie C.

description: I love me some Shotwell's .  Great owners, beers, neighborhood peeps, pool, and pinball.
author: Jason D.

description: This place gets five starts because of the bartender.  He recommended that we go to gracias madre to eat. I am forever grateful to him for that.
author: Laura F.

description:
Ohhhh Shotwells, how you complete me. This just might be my favorite bar in the mission, if not the entire city. Your jukebox is sound. Your pool tables are legit. And your beer selection is top notch. (Any place that serves Dogfish 90 minute IPA's automatically exudes notoriety in my book--Thieves may have you beat just because they serve it on tap).
ANYWAY, finding a pool table in the mission can be difficult, sometimes impossible, but I've always managed to get one there. And if there are people occupying the tables, the players aren't grade-A douche bags playing by their own unorthodox "rules" who bogart the tables with their unruly friends. It's mellow but hip, easy to miss but hard to pass up....Shotwells is a great little local bar that I'm glad to have stumbled across.
author: Jessica U.

description: It's a neighborhood bar, its a 'tasting' room of fine brew.  Put it together and what do you get? The best bar in the city.
author: Suzy M.

description: Good beer makes me happy; therefore, Shotwell's makes me happy. I like the neighborhood feel and of the hipsters there, none were too dirty or pretentious-seeming (in contrast to the ass-grabbing swingers I encountered at Pops later in the night).  I had been when it was the Inner Mission and liked it just the same. Now that I'm back in the Bay Area this will surely be one of my regular watering holes when I'm in the mood for quality beer.
author: Cassandra M.

description: Comfy, clean dive bar. Populated but not over populated. Mission hipster crowd. Dress casual. Places to sit. Room to stand. Pinball and pool tables in the back. With an amazing beer selection. Beer, wine and sake only. Two words, "Mission" and "Dive." Can't complain.
author: Alex H.

description: Friendly bartenders, gregarious patrons, excellent draft selection & a great pub ambiance.
author: Sally M.

description: UPDATE, I'm not observant at all, the pool tables are a dollar a round, not free as I stated before. Still the most legit bar in all the land. Great crowd, great owners, large selection of awesome beer. They also have a twitter feed (@shotwellsbar) and do beer float days with Humphry Slocombe every so often. I haven't had the pleasure of being there for one of these, but I hear nothing but good things.
author: Matt F.

description: Very chill place.  Has great atmosphere and good bartenders.  The best thing yet, they allow dogs!  Awesome.
author: Tony N.

description: This is definitely a neighborhood gem. By that I mean definitely the cleanest bar I've been to in the Mission. It gets 5 stars for that. Great warm vibe and not overly crowded. My group of friends like to stop by for a few beers and to play pool. They have a decent selection of beer and it's not too pricey. This bar is an inviting and casual place to kick it with your friends on a weekend night when you're not trying to do anything too big!
author: Janie Y.

description:
kostritzer dunkel on tap. among other really great beers.  but they have more in bottles than on tap. which you don't immediately realize from the menu, especially when you're jockeyed by your own reflection staring back at you, quizzically surveying the menu.  that is a real shame, though - the bottled beer, not the reflection, well, not necessarily.  i'll change my review to a full 5 stars when they get the bottled to draft ratio right.  (oh, and if they would try to enforce the sf health code and not allow dogs in the bar.  i love 'em too, but out on the street people who are highly allergic - like yours truly - retain the option of not petting and crossing the street if need be.  i don't like getting driven out of enclosed spaces when i want another.)

good space, crimson walls studded with old saloon mirrors.  good place to stop in for good beer at good prices, friendly and great bartenders.  but after the third round i remembered what the problem was with beer only bars - no gin or whiskey.  they must have had wine too but i never got passed the beer list.  and i don't want to pull apart every dog hair landing on my nose but i really think they ought to go back to their previous name as "beer parlor", which is a whole lot less misleading than "bar" which suggests to me there might be more than beer.  but maybe this was a first step and they're working on getting their alcohol license? i'll definitely be back when that happens.  but for now i'll be hitting up shotwell's beer parlor when i'm on this pretty tree-lined street in this part of the hood.
author: Nikki F.

description: They have a working Medieval Madness pinball machine. I don't need to say anything else.
author: Morgan S.

description: Good solid spot to meet up w/ friends.  Great beers.  Friendly bar keep who suggested most everything we ordered and never dissapointed. Not pretentious and an overall clean and beautiful bar.
author: Natalie W.

description: Why five stars? They have YOUNG'S DOUBLE CHOCOLATE STOUT on TAP, only the GREATEST STOUT EVER. Please message me if you know of another bar in the city that has it ON TAP. I love this bar. Did I mention that I love this bar?
author: Maximillian M.

description: Great prices, unpretentious, good people, cool bartenders, wide selection of beers, lots of seating.  Can't be beat.  One of my top 3 favorite bars in the city.
author: Victoria M.

description:
ended up being better than i expected.
the juke box is full of old school goodies. got a table on a saturday night.

the douche was in full effect that night. i think they were out of towners who were lost......

friends were very impressed at the beer selection.
quiet enough to chat with everyone in my group.

the negative..the bathroom was the stinkiest bathroom i have even been in. hands down. i thought i was going to die. 

will go back..just run the couple blocks home to piss.
author: dawn a.

description: Great little pub for SF area, the place is well over 100 years old which makes it fasinating in it's own right...have all types of beers but you better know your beers cause if you don't you might choose something that kinda sucks (like I did, but can't blame them that's my fault)...I tried my other friends beers and they were amazing! so definatly check this place out if you are looking for a chill pub to come have a brewski at
author: Andrew M.

description: Real tight place. My dog had a helluva time, and I enjoyed myself as well.
author: Jason M.

description: Love my local. Friendly people, cheap pool and good beer. Oh, and if you happen to be on your own - the bar staff are great company.
author: Brett W.

description: I'd like to spend some more time here. It's dark and cozy.
author: Monika M.

description: The beer is great, the crowd is pretty chill and non-assuming, and the PINBALL.  Oh lordy, I lost about a week's pay into that Midieval Madness pinball game.  You can get a crowd going just waiting to play that thing. 5 balls for 75 cents. I think I'm a pinball convert.
author: Mark P.

description: Came here after getting tired of the Elbow Room. This place is pretty quiet but at the time that was a good thing. I loved their Hefeweizen on tap. They do not serve liquor here so beware if you are trying to get hammered.
author: Darius A.

description: Solid neighborhood bar with an outstanding selection of beers.  Would be a four-star bar except that no bar that doesn't serve liquor can get higher than 3 stars from me.
author: G Y.

description: Great beer. Good atmosphere and a friendly bar maid. What more do you want? Drink up Johnnie!
author: Scott K.

description: Formerly know as Inner Mission.. Different name, same bar.. I think this new moniker suits it very well...  Beer, pool, jukebox.. All u need for a great neighborhood bar..
author: Carlo M.

description: It was supposed to be a few wines on a mellow Saturday afternoon but then we got to Shotwell's and it was all over!  We got there early enough to snag a pool table and take over the jukebox........very surprising music collection - it was either The Clash or the yummy white wine that made me fall in love with this place!  The beer was awesome too....as was the bartender.  Great atmosphere and no snobby people!!
author: B P.

description: You can't beat the combination this place has got going on...  2 pool tables, 2 pinball machines, sweet jukebox, great eclectic beer selection, cool owners (who are still damn cool after your group breaks a few glasses).  What's not to love?  I love this place so much, I follow their Twitter feed.  Bad-effing-ass.
author: Andy H.

description: This place is chill, dark, and has a great beer collection. They have some great Belgium brews. Try the Duchess, a sweet, dark temptress, vinegary, and delicious beer.
author: Spoke K.

description: Love this place. Great beer, music, and staff.
author: Paul S.

description:
I'd give this place one star, if my conscience would let me, in order to keep people away from my favorite bar.

But it won't, so I can't.

Great selection of beers, awesome vibe and patrons, five ball pinball machines and the best bartenders ever.  Now stay away.
author: Daniel F.

description: A hidden gem.  Very clean, airy, with bartenders who really know their beer/spirits. Large selection of beer from all over the world, and just very comfortable in a neighborhood bar kind of way.
author: Kris A.

description: This is a great place to go if you truly enjoy tasting beer. An extensive selection of imports and domestics alike, and great ambiance coupled with knowledgeable and friendly staff make this a favorite of mine. Doesn't fit a stereotype. I Love Shotwell's!
author: T M.

description: Super chill bartenders. They have all sorts of beers on tap, and they know their beer. It's lively but not so much that you can't hold a conversation.
author: Victor L.

description: Solid beer selection, superb owners, great pinball, killer jukebox, chill crowd, nice location, awesome atmosphere, rocking happy hour. It's my go-to and I love it.
author: Alexis W.

description: this is my new favorite bar. great jukebox. awesome saturday bartender.  good beer selection. 2 pool tables. bike racks.
author: Hello D.

description: awesome neighborhood bar and fantastic beer collection.  i didn't recognize much but I told the bartender (who was very cool) what kind of beer I like and they picked one out for me.
author: Erin K.

description: lovely little bar away from the main stretch of mission. perfect for some lowkey hanging out and drinking with friends. they have a decent selection of beers and also a few sake options. for some reason, the medieval madness pinball machine randomly gave us 3 free games.
author: Angi C.
